text: Most Pythonic Way to Split an Array by Repeating Elements
I have a list of items that I want to split based on a delimiter.
I want all delimiters to be removed and the list to be split when a delimiter occurs twice.
For example, if the delimiter is 'X', then the following list:
Notice that the last set is not split.
I've written some ugly code that does this, but I'm sure there is something nicer.
Extra points if you can set an arbitrary length delimiter (i.e.
split the list after seeing N delimiters).
